title: [BUG] Unable to load library 'libSkiaSharp'. Web .NET 4.7.2 - Windows & Azure
body:
**Description**
I'm sadden I have to open this here, but I have been looking for more than 2 hours and I still can't find a solution!
When using a .NET Framework program or .NET Core program, it works great, however, when I use a Web Application that uses the same code, I get the following message. This is the same thing when deploying on Azure (not as an Azure Function, just a WebApp)

```
Unable to load library 'libSkiaSharp'.
at SkiaSharp.LibraryLoader.LoadLocalLibrary[T](String libraryName)
↵   at SkiaSharp.SkiaApi.<>c.<.cctor>b__1723_0()
↵   at System.Lazy`1.CreateValue()
↵   at System.Lazy`1.LazyInitValue()
↵   at System.Lazy`1.get_Value()
↵   at SkiaSharp.SkiaApi.GetSymbol[T](String name)
↵   at SkiaSharp.SkiaApi.sk_managedstream_set_procs(SKManagedStreamDelegates procs)
↵   at SkiaSharp.SKAbstractManagedStream..cctor()"

====

at SkiaSharp.SKAbstractManagedStream..ctor(Boolean owns)
↵   at SkiaSharp.SKManagedStream..ctor(Stream managedStream, Boolean disposeManagedStream)
↵   at SkiaSharp.SKCodec.WrapManagedStream(Stream stream)
↵   at SkiaSharp.SKBitmap.Decode(Stream stream)
```

The /bin folder contains SkiaSharp.dll. I included the Nuget package in the Web csproj. I added `    <ShouldIncludeNativeSkiaSharp>True</ShouldIncludeNativeSkiaSharp>`. Still nothing.

This is not the first time it seems to happen, more than one bug report had been opened about this.
But I see really no easy solution nor documentation about this.
What is the correct way to statically link this or make it work :) ?

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  2.80.1
- Last known good version:  ?
- IDE:  Visual Studio
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Windows Classic:  Windows 10
  - Azure: Web App
